meanings.definition: A mixture of powdered aluminum and a metal oxide, used in welding and incendiary devices.
meanings.sent1: The welder used thermite to join the metal pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters used thermite to control the blaze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon accidentally set off the thermite, creating a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like thermite, melting away any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The bright glow of the thermite lit up the dark night sky.

meanings.definition: To weld or destroy with thermite.
meanings.sent1: The workers decided to thermite the broken railings back together.
meanings.sent2: The demolition crew used thermite to bring down the old building.
meanings.sent3: The kids joked that they could thermite their homework to make it disappear.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to thermite through her icy exterior, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The anger in his voice seemed to thermite the tension in the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
